Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is Friday morning and it is another beautiful day in Scranton, Pennsylvania. [sees man in a turban outside] Oh my God. Ohhh. [dials phone number] Pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up. Oh, we have a serious problem here. [goes out onto office floor] Alright everybody, lock the doors, turn off the lights. Pretend you're not here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are we in danger?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's no time to think about if this is real. Just, shh, everybody. [knock at the front door]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, should I call the... [Michael waves his hands] What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The IT tech guy and me did not get off to a great start.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I tried to install it myself, but, uh, you guys have these things so password-protected...

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: That just means you have to enter your password.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: What's your password, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, umm... [looks at Post-It on computer]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mi-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: AH! Guh-oood.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please don't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I'm sorry. What is going on in there? Why is he here? What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have to tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have to tell you anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, Michael, I know you don't want to have to think about this, but if something were to happen to you, God forbid, then I would need to know in order to take over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, nothing is going to happen to me, ok? I'm in the best shape of my life. Look at this. [flexes his arms] Brrr! That's strong!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but that doesn't matter, you could get a brain aneurysm-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going get a brain-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or get hit by a car-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or a bus or a train. Get poisoned, fall in a well, step on a mine, choke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, oh, ok; if I step on a mine in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and die, you can have my job, ok? Why don't you just go... away?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are certain things a boss does not share with his employees. His salary, that would depress them. His bed, it-- And I am not going to tell them that I'll be reading their e-mails.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So how do you search?

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: By keyword phrase.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Try "profits". No! Try "Michael Scott". "Michael" "boss" and "funny". [Sadiq (IT guy) types; result pops up] Oh my God, wow! [chuckles] E-mail from Stanley. Stanley, Terribly nice guy. [reads e-mail] "Sorry I didn't write back sooner; I can't go to the game tonight because my boss Michael is an ass and making me stay late." Well, Stanley's an ass. Not one of our harder workers.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, what's the deal, Michael? Why are you spying on our computers?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, everybody; Oscar's gone crazy! What other ghost stories do you have for us? That I'm a robot? [robot voice] I will destroy everything in my path-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, it's just-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Beep! Bop!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bommmm. Bop! Onk onk. [Tin Man voice] Oil can. Oil can.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Tin Man. Actually we just a got a memo from IT saying you're doing e-mail surveillance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, what? No. That defeats the whole purpose.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So it's true? You have access to our e-mails?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what the problem is?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I think I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The problem is that when people hear the term "big brother", they immediately think it's scary or bad, but I don't. I think, wow, I love my big brother.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I gotta erase a lotta stuff. A lot of stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh hey, just so ya know, if you have a lot of sensitive e-mails, they need to be deleted immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. [Pam overhears]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers to Jim] Hey. Something just happened. Dwight just told Angela that she has to deleted all of her sensitive e-mails immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think that they're like-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, right, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [humming]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uhhh, ew, ew, ew... Maybe?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's like squishing a spider under a book. It's gonna be really gross but I have to look and make sure that it's really dead. Sooo... [to camera guys] If you guys see anything... ?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight, um, my friend is kinda into these two girls that he works with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: One is tall and brunette, and the other one is short, and blonde, and perky, and kinda judgmental. Who do you think he should choose?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does he have access to their medical records?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ummmm...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think one of the greatest things about modern America is the computerization of medical records. As a volunteer sheriff, I can look up anyone's psychiatric records or surgical histories. Yeast infections. There are a huge number of yeast infections in this county. Probably because we are down river from that old bread factory.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith has an E-vite from Jim. Barbeque at Jim's tonight. Tonight? Wonder where my e-vitation is. Click on guest list. Angela, Stanley, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Kevin, Creed. Must be... .[scrolls down list] No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Listen, are you bringing anyone to Jim's party tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. Are we supposed to?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. I mean, I don't know, I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hmm... [Pam reaches towards vending machine] Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's always a distance between a boss and the employees. It is just nature's rule. It's intimidation mostly, it's the awareness that they are not me. I do think that I am very approachable, as one of the guys. But maybe I need to be even approachabler.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's pretty young.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Are you gonna eat with us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course. Hangin' with my crew, crew that I am one of. Hangin' with my Cup of Noodles. This is a meal in a cup.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh hum.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hot, tasty. Reminds me of college. Lived on this stuff. Brain food. Mmmm... You know what I really, really miss about college? The parties. Everybody'd go. The athletes, the, the nerds, professors.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The professors would go to the parties?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! They were the most fun. We always invited them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's true. I'm having a party. I've got three cases of imported beer, a karaoke machine, and I didn't invite Michael. So three ingredients for a great party. And it's nothing personal, I just think that if he were there, people wouldn't be able to relax, and you know, have fun, and my roommate wants to meet everybody. Because I'm pretty sure he thinks that I'm making Dwight up. [sighs] He is very real.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to cameraman] What? [looks at Dwight eating a Baby Ruth] Ohhhh... Yes! Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, Dwight thinks that tonight is a surprise party for Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe we can get him to hide and wait somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh man. Oh, you know what, speaking of which, I was just trying to get a handle on, you know, numbers for food and stuff. So do you think that Roy's gonna come, or...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no, he can't make it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, ok, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Almost quittin' time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, it's, uh, four o'clock.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One more hour. Take care of anything you forgot to do. Hey, you know, I don't know if you have any plans tonight, but if ya don't, we could hang out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, um... .I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have plans.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh hmm, definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do, too. I do, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do, yeah. Big plans.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because you said "do you wanna hang out"-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tonight, I can't do it tonight, no. Improv class, I have improv class, hanging out with my improv buds-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aw, that sounds like a lot of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's the best. It's the best. I would not miss it for the world. But if something else came up, I would definitely not go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Improv sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [someone coughs] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think Stanley just coughed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam. Do you need me to walk to your vehicular transport?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Oscar, got big plans tonight with-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm on a call.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, big man, big man, what are you doing tonight? Where are you off to?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My brother is in town and we are going to see the Alaska Film Festival at the Scien-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela, rushy, rushy. Where you rushin' off to?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm just leaving for the day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well duh. Where ya headed?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Charity. Bake drive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Liar!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are a liar.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, oh ho, Dwight, Dwight, my loyal compadre. You and I are hangin' tonight. The two of us. We are celebrating our freedom and our manhood. You know what? Why don't we watch that show that you've been wanting to watch, that stupid Battleship Galaxy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Battlestar Galatica.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's, whatever stupid show you want-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To watch tonight

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're watching it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Unfortunately, I've got plans. I have to go to practice. Soccer practice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't know you played soccer, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Clarinet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You, too, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have fun tonight! Whatever it is that you're doing, and I'll see you Monday. [to the camera] He has no idea!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Quick announcement everybody, if I could have everybody's attention. We do have wine in the kitchen, and, uh, there is beer available on the porch and despite what you might think, it's not all for Meredith and Kelly, so please enjoy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! You really think this is a good idea, huh? A hide-a-key rock?

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Hey, you must be Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't work with us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's because Mark's my roommate.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Hey, I love the Birkenstocks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks. Yeah, I always keep an extra set in the car, for special occasions. Jim, come here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When is the guest of honor coming?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, later-ish.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's gonna love it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. [to a group of guests] Just wanna let you guys know that we will be taking the tour like I promised-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! Just in time! You wanna go on the group tour? We were just about to leave.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, the group tour is now leaving, then. Ladies and gentlemen, just a few things that we are gonna be pointing out to you today, you will be able to see both bedrooms and, uh, if we're lucky, maybe get a chance to peek into the bathroom, who knows. I have to remind you that flash photography is prohibited and as much as you can, please refrain from touching things. I know you might want to.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, is Katy coming?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, actually, I haven't talked to her in a while.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Huh, is it ok if I call her?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can talk about that later.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, let's get right into it. I need two people for the first scene.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [In Horshack voice from 'Welcome Back, Kotter'] Ooo Ooo Ooo Ooo, Mr. Cart-air, Mr. Cart-air.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, Michael. And... anybody? How about Mary-Beth? Come on. Ok, so you start us off Mary-Beth.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Great. [skips] La la la la la laaa...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [fake kicks in door] Boom! Detective Michael Scarn. I'm with the FBI.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Think about this; what is the most exciting thing that can happen, on TV, or in movies, or in real life? Somebody has a gun. [gasps] That's why I always start with a gun, because you can't top it, you just can't.

Quote.Speaker: Girl acting Pregnant
Quote.Text: I'm supposed to meet my doctor here? Have ya seen him? He's a very angry midget.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boom! Freeze! Michael Scoon, FBI. You know what you did. Boom! Boom! Boom! [shoots at Pregnant Girl and another actor] Yeah, you thought that you could get away with your little ruse, didn't you? Didn't ya!? Well, you didn't, because I know where ya hid the diamonds. I been on to you and your little friends for weeks. [another actor steps in] Boom! Boom! Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Actor
Quote.Text: I'm not even in the scene!

Quote.Speaker: Actress
Quote.Text: Again!?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boom! Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Stop, stop, ok, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boom! Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: You shot me, great. Now stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: You can't just shoot everyone in the scene.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, if you hadn't stopped the scene, you would have seen where it was going.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, what about the scene they set up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boring.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: No, it wasn't. No more guns.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could of-

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: No. No. Michael, I want you to give me all the guns you have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Just, I want you to get rid of all your guns and give them to me. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yehhhehh.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Yeeehh, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's bedroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See, I knew we lost somebody on the tour. It's-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool... This is your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Your home office?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My home office, this is it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Down. You have to sit down so I can get the full effect.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, sure. Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, wait, so that would make me [walks to side of room] like right here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, that... Yep, that feels about right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Dwight would be like-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Let's just leave that image out of it, because this is a happy place. Happy thoughts, Pam. Happy thoughts.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm, [gasps] yearbook!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you don't have to, ummm. Alright, yes, that's not gonna be awkward at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [finds Jim's picture] Ooooohhh no!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You were so dorky!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Freeze!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: You wanna go over the rules one more time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. I'm looking in my wallet for money so you can tell me my fortune.

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: I promise it's worthit . Ooo, I can see you walking out of here and you're thrilled with your reading.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you... [whispers to Bill]

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Michael, what did you tell him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Then why are his hands up? Bill?

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: He told me he couldn't show it to me, but he has a gun.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, let's call it a day. Nice job, Bill.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, it's good. Good work, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Angela, burger? Dog? Havin' fun?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I got sap on me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Chicken, hot dog, burger.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm a vegetarian.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There is soda inside.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Guh.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I didn't think the premium laser color copy batch would sell as well as it did.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, it surprised us all. I'll tell you why. Because when they--

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry guys; can we please not talk about paper? There's gotta be something else we can talk about.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think it's alright. Jesus drank wine. [Pam overhears]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Phyllis, come here for a second.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have you heard anything about any secret office romances?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You tell me. Well, you do mean you and Jim right? Oh God. I am so sorry, I thought, you guys hang out all the time and you're talking all the time. I'm sorry!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's ok. It's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [smacks Ryan's hand] Not so fast... Fire Guy.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: How do I get to Bernie's Tavern from here?

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: Oh, don't worry. We're all gonna carpool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So Bernie's, huh? We're all going to Bernie's? [to camera] Go to Bernie's?

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: Oh sorry, we're not going as a group, it's just a private friend who just happens to know all of us from different ways is throwing a private birthday thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, right, right. Well guys, I'd love to go to Bernie's with you, but, you know, I have an office party. A big office party I need to go to, so... Can't get out of it.

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, see you later. Nice job, Bill. Not.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [singing] Here I go again on my own. Going down the only road I've ever known...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh by the way how's your side project going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah I gave that up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, it turns out I was, um, just grasping at straws.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just because two people are hanging out, it doesn't mean that they're together, you know? Like people can just be friends. And I think that it was really unfair to think that there was anything else going on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] Just turn around now, cause you're not welcome anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Surprise! [laughs] Everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! Who opened the morgue for this thing? I'm just driving by, thought I'd drop in. [to Jim] There's some wine. I would love a glass, if you're gonna open it. Here ya go Temp, take my jacket! [sees Sadiq] Oh, come on! That guy? He is a good guy, not a terrorist. Karaoke, I love it! I am a karaoke fiend. I call dibs. I got next, I got next up. Come on, let's get this party started, ha! Ok? Where's that wine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, yeah, this is a duet, so, need somebody else, Pam? You wanna come up and sing this one? Need somebody else. Takers, please. [singing] Baby when I met you there was peace unknown. Kelly? Tried to get you with a fine tooth comb. I was soft inside, there was something goin' on. This part goes to the, uh, girl. You do something to me that I can't explain. Hold me closer and I feel no pain. In every beat of my heart, we got something goin' on. Tender love is blind--

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Jim
Quote.Text: [singing] It requires a dedication, all this love we feel needs no conversation. Divided, together, uh huh. Making love with each other, uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're making love!

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Jim
Quote.Text: [singing] Islands in the stream, that is what we are, no one in between, how can we be wrong? Sail away with me...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Talk! Just talk!

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: I am-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Funny story:

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Oscar shakes his leg] You're going to have to stop that. [Oscar moves over] I can still feel it.

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: Do you have a question or something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: About my turban, maybe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, nope. I actually wear a turban sometimes. Wanna see it?

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got it right here. [pulls out Karnak turban]

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: Why do you have that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Comedy; it's funny. It's Johnny Carson, Karnak. It's, um, put it back. Huhhhh, did you have Johnny Carson in your land?

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: In Pittsburgh? Yeah, but I never really watched him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. You were forbidden.

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: No, I'm much younger than you. I watched Conan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, I'm gonna, uhh, get a cup of coffee. Do you want some coffee er-

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or some tea or hummus or something?

Quote.Speaker: Sadiq
Quote.Text: No, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, this isn't good.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't even know what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Should have done this a long time ago. Tons of personal e-mails, huge time wasters. Uh, uh huh. Wow, like Kevin, rating the best bars in Scranton? Poor Richard's number seven? Idiot. Stupid load. [phone rings] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael, accounting needs your approval on-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm busy right now. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's a helpful suggestion for Jim. Jim, instead of e-mailing Amazon, to try and get that CD that you didn't receive, I suggest that you go to Visa and tell them to cancel the charge.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, definitely didn't need help with that, but, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's seems like ya did though-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim. Lots of e-mails to Amazon, lots of wasted computer space. Alright, let's get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I assumed Michael was already doing this. That's why I only use my personal e-mail account.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [moves chair to Jim and Dwight's desks] Ooo, bleh bleh bleh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where's your tie?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Just felt like taking it off. Man, work can be just so damn frustrating don't ya think, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's going on, Michael. Talk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, same old stuff. Same old. Boss just been ridin' my ass.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no! Jan!? What's goin' on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't wanna talk about it. I just wanna hang out, just be one of the guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The most important one of the guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not the point.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's exactly the point. You've hit a slump. It happens to the best of us. You just have to remember, you know-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where you come from, and who you are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, you have worked so hard for this. You are the boss; you can buy and sell us with just a snap of your little finger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok yes, I would never do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, no one can snap with their little finger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ha.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, this is hardly the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, this is completely the time, this is perfect time. This is just guys gently ribbing each other, it's what it's all about, just hangin' out. Enjoying friends, all being the same. Worker bees.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And their king bee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just bees, just bees hanging out, buzzing around.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Master bee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not a master bee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Queen bee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just a bee, Dwight, ok, just a bee, just buzzin'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey babe. Hey, how are you!?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You look good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, um, I was wondering if it'd be ok if I go to Lonny's poker game tonight. I promise, it'll be like the last time for a while.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We were supposed to go to the barbeque at Jim's house.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Oh, man. Um, could you go without me? Make something up, say I like, ate something, or...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uhh...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Huh, huh? You're the best. You're the best!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I might be late.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Ok, don't wake me up cause I'm playing ball in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Alright, bye. [Pam looks around the office]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to the cameraman] Did I miss anything?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Five o'clock. Time to go get my improv on. [drinks] Little bit of the comedy juice. Mmm. Alright, see if you can guess what this is. [roars and flails his arms] That is a dinosaur getting ready to go to improv class. Just a taste of the improv.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need to know... who shot Johnson!

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Uh, President Johnson. Um-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a right mind to shoot you right in the head.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: I, I killed him. You're right! It was me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just shut up! I don't wanna hear anything more from you.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: No, listen to what she's saying.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Alright, I'll be quiet if we can make some kind of deal. A deal?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pow! Pow! Pow! Pow! No deal. Not with Michael Scarn, FBI. Michael Scarn doesn't make deals. Michael Scarn shoots and then asks questions later. [blows on his fake gun]

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Good, good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She was kind of tripping me up, cause she was, um, I was trying to get something going, when I was over her with the gun, and she like kept changing the story.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: I don't think... he was saying-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you kept-

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: He kept saying "shut up"-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Going into nuclear something; that's not where the scene was going.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: I-

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: It goes wherever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it goes, it goes in the best direction, and that was not the best direction.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: I felt like he was ordering me around, cause he-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he, Michael Scarn, that character, orders people around, and that's, you should of just gone-

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: All your characters order people around though, and-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: There's stronger choices.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think there's any stronger choice than being a really strong character.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: We've seen you do that character before though. I mean, you know, that's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's, like, well, it's, you know, when refine it, refine a character down to its essence, that's...

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Like Jim Carrey or something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Right, well I wasn't saying that-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Nah, I know, I just meant that... he shot me, I just-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or Ryan Stiles, something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Yeah, ya know maybe, he made me get on the ground, and I didn't feel safe in this game.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You shouldn't have been, 'cause you were dealing with Michael Scarn. That was exactly what I was hoping to achieve, so that is probably the best thing you could have said, that's a compliment.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: You succeeded.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good work.

Quote.Speaker: Mary-Beth
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And in this room here, if you look closely, you will find out a few clues about who lives here. Um, he likes biking, obviously, and uh, what else? Uh, he likes tour guides, I guess. And if you're very perceptive, you'll notice that he didn't do a great job of cleaning his room [kicks water bottle under bed]. Ok, and uh, that's the tou-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And he's really into penguins or something?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, thank you, Ryan, uh, I don't know, I think I made the mistake one day of telling someone that I like penguins, and here we are.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. I gave you a penguin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's why it's on my desk, Phyllis; it means a lot to me, and now that I know it was from you, it means even more. Moving on! Uh, ok, so that's the end of the tour for now, and if you liked it please tell your friends:

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, for the next exercise, let's everyone pair up.[everyone picks a partner] And everyone got somebody? Ok, good. [Michael is partner-less] Uh, ok, uh, why don't you go out in the hallway and go through all the rules in your head. Ok, you take a break and sort of run through the rules in your head. Ok, stay there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll just throw out some suggestions.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Ok, you guys wanna start? [to Michael] Don't throw out any-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're in a whorehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: Suggestions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And he's a proctologist. [to teacher] What?

Quote.Speaker: Improv Teacher
Quote.Text: We don't need a suggestion for this one; it's gonna come from them. [to other students] It's a game called "Yes, and?" and uh, you will say the first sentence. And uh, you're telling a story-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: First sentence is:

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why don't you turn it up? [Ryan moves to turn up the grill] Uh! Not so fast... Fire Guy. Think we need some more heat, Fire Guy? Hey, Fire Guy, maybe we should burn Jim's house down.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's really funny.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Kelly; I called him Fire Guy.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Good one, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah... hey Stanley-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He called me Fire Guy.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, good one. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It never gets old.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Never gets old.
